questions.question: She congratulated …………………………..
questions.description: When the subject and the object refer to the same person, use the reflexive pronoun.

questions.question: You are worse than …………………………….
questions.description: Object pronouns are considered more appropriate after as and than.

questions.question: He stabbed ………………………….. with a knife.
questions.description: When the subject and the object refer to the same person, use the reflexive pronoun.

questions.question: ‘Whose car is this?’ ‘It is …………………………..’
questions.description: It is hers means the same as it is her car.

questions.question: He lives on ………………………….. own.
I did it …………………………… as there was no one to help me.
Please eat more vegetables and do …………………………. a favor.
It is your fault, not ………………………….
questions.description: Not mine means the same as not my fault.

questions.question: I showed her my ID proof, but she couldn’t show me ………………………………
That cat of ………………………….. has drank my milk.
I ……………………….. spoke to the Minister.
questions.description: For emphasis, use the emphatic pronoun.

questions.question: This cat is …………………………..
questions.description: That cat is theirs means the same as that is their cat.

questions.question: Whose bag is this? It is …………………………
questions.description: Mine is a possessive pronoun it is used alone. My is a possessive adjective. It is followed by a noun.

questions.question: He patted ………………………. on the back.
questions.description: When the subject and object refer to the same person, use the reflexive pronoun.

questions.question: Each one of .............................. narrated their own version of the story.
questions.description: Use an object pronoun after a preposition.

questions.question: She asked me what ………………………… problem was.
questions.description: We use the possessive adjective my to modify the noun problem here.

questions.question: That child of ……………………………. has broken my window.
They elected …………………………. their leader.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a verb should be in its object form.

questions.question: I waited for ………………………… but they didn’t come.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of  preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: She is taller than ……………………………. is.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the subject of a verb should be in its subject form.

questions.question: I don’t want to go with ………………………………
Be careful or you will injure ……………………………
questions.description: When the subject and object refer to the same person, use the reflexive pronoun.

questions.question: Please do it ………………………….
You are no better than ………………………….
questions.description: Object pronouns are more common after than and as.

questions.question: I asked …………………………… what he was doing there.

questions.question: I told ………………….. to leave.
Why are you yelling at ………………………….?
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: I am convinced that ………………………….. is lying to me.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the subject of a verb should be in its subject form. Subject pronouns are: he, she, they, we, I, you and it.

questions.question: It took ……………………………… quite some time to get used to living alone.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of the verb should be in its object form. Object pronouns are: him, her, me, us, them, you and it.

questions.question: I waited for …………………………….. but he didn’t come.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: The child is waiting for ……………………………… mother.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: Don’t interfere with …………………………….
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: I don’t want to see ………………………………
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of the verb should be in its object form. Object pronouns are: him, her, me, us, them, you and it.

questions.question: Why don’t you listen to ………………………………….?
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: I have invited all of ……………………………. to my party.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: None of …………………………….. are interested in this.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: She is younger than ……………………..
questions.description: Object pronouns are preferred after as and than. Subject pronouns are unusual unless they are accompanied by verbs.

questions.question: She works hard to support ……………………… family.
I never realized that …………………….. was making a mistake.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the subject of a verb should be in its subject form.

questions.question: She asked ……………………… what …………………… wanted.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the verb should be in its object form. Here him is the object of the verb asked and he is the subject of the verb wanted.

questions.question: The young boy is eager to please ………………………. employer.
What she said made no sense to ……………………..
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: They took ………………………… to the doctor.
questions.description: Here him is the object of the verb took.

questions.question: I have known ……………………….. for a long time.
questions.description: They is a subject pronoun and them is an object pronoun. A pronoun used as the object of a verb should be in its object form.

questions.question: This is my bag. Which one is ………………………….?
questions.description: Yours is the possessive form of you.

questions.question: That red car is ………………………….
Whose bag is this? It is …………………………
questions.description: Her is an object pronoun hers is its possessive form.

questions.question: He made …………………….. wait for hours.
questions.description: Me is the object form of the pronoun I.

questions.question: Sam hasn’t returned the razor ………………………….. borrowed from ………………………
questions.description: A pronoun used as a subject should be in its subject form and object should be in its object form.

questions.question: What are you doing in ……………………………. room?
questions.description: The possessive forms of pronouns are - my, mine, his, her, hers, their, theirs, your and yours.

questions.question: Why is ………………………….. so angry today?
questions.description: A pronoun used as the subject should be in its subject forms. Subject pronouns are: he, she, they, you, we and it.

questions.question: I don’t know what happened to ……………………………
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form. Examples are: her, him, me, you, them and us.

questions.question: I didn’t recognize ……………………. but ……………………. recognized …………………..
It took ……………………………. quite some time to realize what ……………………… was doing.
They have never invited ………………………… to ………………………. parties.
I expected ………………………… to arrive but ………………………. didn’t.
I asked …………………………… what ………………………. problem was.
You should have invited ………………………………
questions.description: Here the pronoun them is the object of the verb invited. Them is the object form of they.

questions.question: I don’t know ………………………… personally.
questions.description: Her is the object form of she.

questions.question: Will you do …………………………. a favour?
I have a solution to ……………………………. problem.
questions.description: Before a noun, use the possessive form of the pronoun.

questions.question: She has never thanked ………………………….. for anything.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a verb should be in its object form.

questions.question: I don’t know how she spends ………………………….. time.
questions.description: Use the possessive form of the pronoun before a noun.

questions.question: They asked her what ……………………………. was doing there.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the subject of the verb should be in its subject form.

questions.question: She looked at ………………………………… angrily.
questions.description: Object forms of pronouns are used after prepositions.

questions.question: My car is faster than ………………………………..
We have invited all the friends ……………………………… have.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the subject of the verb should be in its subject form.

questions.question: They organized a small party for ……………………………… friends.
……………………………. bag is this?
She asked me what …………………………….. was looking for.
No one loves …………………………….. more than my mother.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of the verb should be in its object form.

questions.question: I love him more than ……………………………
questions.description: The subject and object form of you is the same - you.

questions.question: Each of these colors ………………………… you.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after each.

questions.question: ……………………………. to the party.
questions.description: Both is not used with 'not'.

questions.question: All of my friends ……………………….. arrived.
questions.description: Use a plural verb after all.

questions.question: Each of these puppies …………………………. up for adoption.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after each.

questions.question: Each of these roads ……………………….. to the station.
Everyone of them ………………………… present there.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after every, everyone, everybody.

questions.question: Let …………………………. get going.
questions.description: Use the object form of the verb after let.

questions.question: Your need is greater than ……………………………
questions.description: Mine means my need.

questions.question: None of us ………………………….. seen him before.
questions.description: We usually use a singular verb after none.

questions.question: I like these …………………………… of movies.
questions.description: Use a plural expression after these and those.

questions.question: People starve when ………………………….. have no money.
questions.description: Use they to refer to people.

questions.question: Somebody wanted a drink, …………………………..?
questions.description: In question tags, use they to refer to somebody, anybody and nobody.

questions.question: I want you to help …………………………… with my homework.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object should be in its object form.

questions.question: She said that she couldn’t do anything to help …………………………..
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object should be in its object form.

questions.question: We are all waiting for …………………………….
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in the object form. The subject and object form of you are the same - you.

questions.question: That cat of …………………………… has scratched me again.
He is a friend of ……………………………..
questions.description: The possessive form is used after the preposition in this structure.

questions.question: One of …………………………….. friends is a sailor.
questions.description: The possessive form of the pronoun can be used as an adjective to modify nouns.

questions.question: None of ………………………………. can do anything about it.
questions.description: The object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: Between you and ………………………………. I don’t trust him.
questions.description: The object is a preposition should be in its form.

questions.question: My car is faster than …………………………………..
He earns more than ……………………………… do.
questions.description: The subject pronoun is used before a verb.

questions.question: I ……………………………… decorated the hall.
She blamed …………………………….. for the mistake.
questions.description: Either herself or him can be used here with different meanings.

questions.question: He is smarter than ...................
questions.description: You has the same subject and object form.

questions.question: He lives on ..................... own terms.
questions.description: We need a possessive adjective here hence we use his.

questions.question: The old woman is quite fond of .................... grandchildren.
questions.description: We need a possessive adjective here. The words your, my, our, his, her and their are possessive adjectives.

questions.question: Can you show me ..................... passport?
questions.description: We need a possessive adjective here. The words your, my, our, his, her and their are possessive adjectives.

questions.question: I know ................... and .................... parents.
questions.description: A pronoun used an object should be in its object form. Before a noun, we need a possessive adjective.

questions.question: This is my passport. Can you show me .........................?
questions.description: The words mine, his, hers, theirs, ours and yours are possessive pronouns. They are used alone.

questions.question: That purse is .........................
questions.description: The words mine, his, hers, theirs, ours and yours are possessive pronouns. They are used alone.

questions.question: That dog of ..................... is always barking at me.
questions.description: The words mine, his, hers, theirs, ours and yours are possessive pronouns. They are used alone.

questions.question: Whose bag is this? It is ......................
questions.description: The words mine, his, hers, theirs, ours and yours are possessive pronouns. They are used alone.

questions.question: When are you going to return the camera you borrowed from ………………………….?
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: Does she understand what .................... is doing?
questions.description: A pronoun used as a subject should be in its subject form.

questions.question: What she says or does makes no sense to ………………………….
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: Sam enjoys riding my bicycle. Sometimes I lend .................... to ................
questions.description: Use the object form of the pronoun after a preposition.

questions.question: She cooked the lunch .....................
This is my uncle ................... lives in the US.
questions.description: That cannot be used to refer to people in non-identifying relative clauses.

questions.question: If we ask ...................., she will show .................... how to solve the problem.
Here is the passenger ....................... bag was lost.
questions.description: Whose indicates possession.

questions.question: This is the movie ....................... won the award.
questions.description: Which is used to refer to things.

questions.question: Jaipur, ...................... is called the pink city, is the capital of Rajasthan.
questions.description: That cannot be used in non-identifying relative clauses.

questions.question: The dog hurt ......................
questions.description: We use reflexive pronouns when the subject and object refer to the same person or thing.

questions.question: I ..................... went to the mall and bought it.
They ......................... fixed the problem.
They have visited our home a few times but we have never been to ………………….
questions.description: Theirs is a possessive pronoun their is a possessive adjective it is used before a noun.

questions.question: That cat of ………………….. has drunk my milk.
Each of these boys ………………….cricket well.
questions.description: Each is followed by a singular verb.

questions.question: Everyone of them …………………… present.
questions.description: Every, everyone, everybody etc. are followed by a singular verb.

questions.question: They all helped ……………………..
questions.description: Each other is used to talk about two people or things. Use one another for more than two.

questions.question: Let …………………….. get going.
questions.description: Let is a verb and a pronoun used as its object should be in its object form.

questions.question: I am not as tall as ………………… is.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the subject of a verb should be in its subject form.

questions.question: Go now and ...........................
questions.description: Enjoy also need an object. This is an imperative sentence and obviously it is addressed to the second person (you).

questions.question: His claim is more legitimate than ……………………..
questions.description: We need a possessive pronoun here.

questions.question: …………………….. are responsible for your failure.
Whoever does best ……………………. get the price.
questions.description: Here the relative clause whoever does best is the subject of the verb will and hence you cannot add another subject here.

questions.question: …………………… to the party.
…………………. are bothers.
questions.description: Second and third person pronouns go before I.

questions.question: Janet and ………………… were present at the party.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the subject should be in its subject form.

questions.question: We are not as poor as …………………….
questions.description: Object pronouns are more common after as and than.

questions.question: Let ……………………… answer the question.
questions.description: Let is a verb a pronoun used as the object of a verb should be in its object form.

questions.question: Between you and ……………………., I don’t trust him.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: We scored as many goals as ………………………..
questions.description: Object pronouns are more common after as and than.

questions.question: Please wait for Rahul and ……………………..
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: Do you know who ……………………… is?
questions.description: A pronoun used as the subject of a verb should be in its subject form.

questions.question: It was …………………………. who did all this.
I love you more than ………………………..
questions.description: Object pronouns are more common after as and than.

questions.question: Nobody but ………………………. was present.
questions.description: Here him is the object of the preposition but.

questions.question: They don’t know what ………………………. are doing.
He has invited you and ……………………… to his party.
The three brothers love ………………………….
questions.description: Each other refers to two people one another refers to more than two people.

questions.question: The husband and the wife should love and respect ………………………….
questions.description: Each other refers to two people one another refers to more than two people.

questions.question: Let …………………………… go now.
questions.description: Let is a verb. A pronoun used as the object of a verb should be in its object form.

questions.question: You are not as intelligent as ……………………………
questions.description: Object pronouns are common after as and than.

questions.question: Neither answer ………………………….. correct.
questions.description: We use a singular verb after either and neither.

questions.question: She is smarter than …………………………….
questions.description: Object pronouns are common after than. Subject pronouns are also possible with a verb.

questions.question: People suffer when ………………………….. do not have money.
questions.description: We use they to refer to people.

questions.question: I enjoy …………………………….. of movies.
questions.description: Use this with kind and these with kinds.

questions.question: I do not trust these ………………………….. of people
questions.description: Use kinds and sorts with these and those.

questions.question: ……………………….. a rainy day, we stayed inside.
My essay is better than ………………………………..
This is my car. Is that ……………………………….?
The two brothers quarreled with ……………………..
questions.description: Each other refers to two people one another refers to more than two people.

questions.question: We must love ………………………….
questions.description: Each other refers to two people one another refers to more than two people. Each other is also possible here in a less careful style.

questions.question: Let ………………………….. buy something to eat.
questions.description: Let is a verb. A pronoun used as the object of a verb should be in its object form.

questions.question: I am not as tall as …………………………..
questions.description: Object pronouns are common after as and than.

questions.question: Each of the boys ………………………………. given a present.
questions.description: We use a singular verb after each.

questions.question: He is older than …………………...
People starve when …………………………… have no money.
questions.description: Use they to refer to the plural noun people.

questions.question: I like …………………………… kind of movies.
questions.description: Use this with kind and these with kinds.

questions.question: I do not like these ………………………….. of people.
questions.description: Use sorts with these and those.

questions.question: ……………………….. a cloudy day, we did not go out.
My handwriting is better than .............................
questions.description: Your handwriting cannot be better than your friend it can only be better than the handwriting (=that) of your friend.

questions.question: My house is smaller ...................................
questions.description: Theirs means their house.

questions.question: Each of these boys …………………………. the guitar.
questions.description: Each is followed by a singular verb.

questions.question: ………………………….. the party.
questions.description: We do not normally write ‘both do/did not’. Instead we use ‘neither’.

questions.question: Each ...................................... has five fingers.
questions.description: We use a singular noun after each and every.

questions.question: Each of these roads ………………………… to the station.
questions.description: Each is followed by a singular verb.

questions.question: Here is my bottle. Please ………………………………
questions.description: Fill is a transitive verb. It is followed by an object.

questions.question: He ………………………… during the holidays.
questions.description: Enjoy is a transitive verb. It requires an object.

questions.question: Let ………………………….. have a look at this.
questions.description: Let is a verb and a pronoun used as its object should be in its object form.

questions.question: I am not as tall as ………………………………….
questions.description: Object pronouns are possible after as and than. If subject pronouns are used they should be followed by a verb.

questions.question: …………………………….. is responsible for his failure.
Whoever does best ……………………………… get the first prize.
People starve when ………………………… have no money.
questions.description: Use the plural pronoun they to refer to the plural noun people.

questions.question: …………………………. a cloudy day, we did not go out.
When I have guests I myself cook dinner for ……………………
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: When she realized her mistake she laughed at ……………………
questions.description: The reflexive is used when the subject and the object refer to the same person.

questions.question: Susie prevented me from entering …………………….. room.
questions.description: The words her, his, their, your, our and my are possessive adjectives. They are used before nouns.

questions.question: She yelled at ………………………… without any provocation.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: That is ………………………….
questions.description: Possessive pronouns are words like mine, his, hers, theirs, ours, yours etc. They are used alone as subject complements.

questions.question: ………………….. bag is this?
This is my car. Is that ………………………….?
I couldn’t believe ……………………….. eyes.
I did it …………………………. as there was no one to help me.
questions.description: The emphatic is used to emphasize an idea.

questions.question: Please do it …………………………..
I cut ………………………… while shaving.
questions.description: The reflexive is used when the subject and the object refer to the same person.

questions.question: She admired ……………………………. in the mirror.
questions.description: The reflexive is used when the subject and the object refer to the same person.

questions.question: ……………………… jeered at the thief.
questions.description: When a pronoun is the subject of the verb, we use the nominative form.

questions.question: There was no way for ……………………….. to escape.
questions.description: The object form of the pronoun is used after a preposition.

questions.question: Between you and …………………………, I don’t trust him.
questions.description: The object form of the pronoun is used after a preposition.

questions.question: Give …………………………. the keys.
I ………………………… cooked dinner.
Suddenly an idea struck ………………………….
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a verb should be in the object form.

questions.question: …………………………….. will bell the cat?
The deer looked at …………………………… reflection in the water.
questions.description: Its is a possessive word like his or her.

questions.question: You could have killed ………………………….
questions.description: When the subject and object refer to the same person, the reflexive pronoun is used for the object.

questions.question: Prospero assured ………………………….. that ………………………… ship was safely anchored.
She told ………………………….. that …………………….. had passed the test.
They accused ……………………… of spoiling ……………………….. plans.
It is ................................ bag.
questions.description: The possessive adjective is used before a noun.

questions.question: He injured ................................ while playing football.
questions.description: When the subject and the object refer to the same person, the reflexive is used.

questions.question: She cooked dinner ......................................
questions.description: The emphatic is used to emphasize an idea.

questions.question: He snatched the paper from ........................................ hand.
questions.description: The possessive adjective is used before a noun the possessive pronoun (mine, yours, ours etc.) is used alone.

questions.question: I can't believe ..................................... story.
questions.description: The possessive adjective is used before a noun the possessive pronoun (mine, yours, ours etc.) is used alone.

questions.question: I saw it with ....................................... own eyes.
questions.description: The possessive adjective is used before a noun the possessive pronoun (mine, yours, ours etc.) is used alone.

questions.question: There was no one to help me so I had to do it .......................................
questions.description: The emphatic pronoun is used to emphasize.

questions.question: Someone broke into .......................................... house while we were away.
questions.description: The possessive adjective is used before a noun the possessive pronoun (mine, yours, ours etc.) is used alone.

questions.question: Please do it ......................................
questions.description: The emphatic pronoun is used to emphasize.

questions.question: I don't think it is ....................................... responsibility.
questions.description: The possessive adjective is used before a noun the possessive pronoun (mine, yours, ours etc.) is used alone.

questions.question: Be careful or you will injure ........................................
questions.description: When the subject and the object refer to the same person, the reflexive is used.

questions.question: It is your fault, not ...........................................
questions.description: The possessive adjective is used before a noun the possessive pronoun (mine, yours, ours etc.) is used alone.

questions.question: She ………………………….. cooked dinner.
questions.description: We use emphatic pronouns for emphasis.

questions.question: I injured ………………………… while playing.
questions.description: The reflexive pronoun is used when the subject and object refer to the same person or thing.

questions.question: ………………………… of these arguments is valid.
questions.description: Both should be followed by a plural verb.

questions.question: The girl lost a ring ………………………….. was made of gold.
questions.description: In identifying relative clauses both which and that can refer to things.

questions.question: This is my friend ……………………….. you met yesterday.
questions.description: Who is possible here in an informal style.

questions.question: The tiger …………………………. was captured last month is now kept in a zoo.
questions.description: In identifying relative clauses both that and which can refer to animals.

questions.question: I saw a man ………………………….. had lost his arms.
Abraham Lincoln was the best President ………………………… ever ruled America.
questions.description: In identifying relative clauses, both who and that can refer to people.

questions.question: The man ………………………… they caught was a thief.
I saw a girl …………………………. eyes were green.
questions.description: Whose is a possessive relative pronoun. It can replace words like her, his etc.

questions.question: ………………………….. of these methods work.
questions.description: Both is followed by a plural verb.

questions.question: I really .................................... when I was on holiday.
questions.description: Enjoyed is a transitive verb and requires an object. If there is no object, we use a reflexive pronoun as the object.

questions.question: He hurt .................................. while playing football.
questions.description: We use reflexive pronouns when the object refers to the same person as the subject.

questions.question: They praised .......................................
questions.description: We use reflexive pronouns when the object refers to the same person as the subject.

questions.question: He patted ...................................... on the back.
questions.description: We use reflexive pronouns when the object refers to the same person as the subject.

questions.question: She was beside ......................................... with sorrow.
questions.description: A reflexive pronoun can be used after a preposition.

questions.question: He did it all by ....................................
questions.description: We use a reflexive pronoun after a preposition.

questions.question: No one loves me better than ................................. do.
questions.description: The reflexive pronoun is used only when the subject and the object refer to the same person or thing.

questions.question: Rani and ................................. went shopping yesterday.
questions.description: The reflexive pronoun is not used as the subject of the verb.

questions.question: The first prize was won by John and ................................
questions.description: The reflexive pronoun is used only when the object refers to the same person as the subject.

questions.question: You have never offered ................................... any help.
This is Samuel ……………………. works with me.
questions.description: The relative pronoun who has one form when it is used as the subject and another form when it is used as the object.

questions.question: This is Samuel with ……………………… I am working at the moment.
questions.description: The relative pronoun who becomes whom when it is used as the object.

questions.question: John and …………………….. are going skiing this weekend.
questions.description: When a pronoun acts as the subject of the verb it should be in its subject form.

questions.question: Between you and ……………………, I think there is trouble in their paradise.
questions.description: Here the pronoun me is the object of the preposition between.

questions.question: With ……………………….. did you go?
questions.description: We must use whom after a preposition.

questions.question: There is the guy ……………………….. we met at the club yesterday.
questions.description: Whom is unusual in identifying relative clauses.

questions.question: This is James, ……………………….. we met at the club yesterday.
questions.description: Whom is common in non-identifying relative clauses.

questions.question: I have a number of English friends and most of …………………….. live in London.
questions.description: We do not use a relative pronoun in a coordinate clause.

questions.question: She has a number of American relatives, most of ………………….. live in Chicago.
questions.description: In a relative clause we use who or whom to refer back to a noun in the main clause.

questions.question: This is the doctor …………………….. lives next door.
questions.description: The relative pronoun acts as the subject or object of the verb in the relative clause. Hence we do not need another noun.

questions.question: ………………………… leaves last should put the lights out.
questions.description: Whoever means the same as ‘the person who’.

questions.question: It is I ………………………. need your help.
questions.description: If we use a subject pronoun after ‘it is’, the subject of the relative clause should be who.

questions.question: Each of these …………………………… cricket well.
questions.description: After each of we use a plural noun and a singular verb.

questions.question: ………………………………. to the party.
questions.description: We do not use both in negative clauses. Instead we use neither.
answers: Both of them did not go

questions.question: ……………………………….. to the party.
questions.description: All is not normally used before a negative verb.

questions.question: ………………………………….. sing.
questions.description: All + noun is not normally used before a negative verb. Instead we use ‘not all + noun’.

questions.question: Each of my children …………………………… me dearly.
questions.description: After each of we use a singular verb.

questions.question: …………………………… of the three roads lead to the station.
questions.description: We use each to speak of two people or things. To refer to more than two people or things, we use all.

questions.question: …………………………… books are lost.
questions.description:
My is a Group A determiner and all is a Group B determiner. We do not normally put a Group A determiner before a Group B determiner. However, we can put a Group B determiner before a Group A determiner and in this case, we use of.
Of can be left out after all.

questions.question: Let …………………………. get going.
questions.description: Let is a verb and a pronoun following it should be in its object form.

questions.question: Your need is greater than ……………………………..
questions.description: Your need is a possessive expression and hence we need another possessive expression after than. Mine is a possessive word.

questions.question: ………………………………. is responsible for his failure.
People starve when ………………………. have no money.
questions.description: We need a plural pronoun to refer to the plural noun people. We is not possible here because it includes the speaker as well.

questions.question: My drawings are better than …………………………….
questions.description: My drawings cannot be better than my friend. They can only be better than the drawings of my friend. We express this idea by adding the expression ‘those of’ before the noun.

questions.question: Diana is one player ………………….. may beat me.
I can’t bear the thought of ...................... leaving.
An argument developed between his sister and .......................
Do you think it is ………………….. who have arrived?
Jane is the person ....................... I think spoke to you.
We don’t think we are as strong as ......................
We are going to the movies. Would you like to come with ..................... .?
I cannot believe that she is older than .....................……
I am not as rich as .....................……, but I am a lot happier.
